question: who was the ottoman governor who led egypt in the years following the napoleonic wars
chain_of_thought_result: The Ottoman governor who led Egypt in the years following the Napoleonic Wars was Muhammad Ali Pasha. He became the de facto ruler of Egypt in the early 19th century and is often credited with modernizing the country and establishing it as a significant regional power. His rule began around 1805 and continued until his death in 1849.
